info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 2:55AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall moving across lower and central Charleston County, including Downtown Charleston. A quick 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain could occur through 415 AM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Charleston, Marion Square, Medical University Of South Carolina, Columbus Street Terminal and The Citadel.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
